content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Emilia Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: Hello Emilia, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you will find my apartment in the heart of Duisburg to be a comfortable and convenient place to live. Let's discuss the price that you are willing to pay for this modern, unfurnished one-bedroom apartment. How much are you planning to offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I would like to offer 400 euros per month.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: I'm sorry, but that offer is too low for the prime location and the quality of the apartment. I'm looking for a price that reflects the value of the property. Would you be willing to increase your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand, I am willing to offer 450 euros per month.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: While your offer is more in line with the value of the apartment, I'm still looking for a price that truly reflects the prime location and the amenities provided. Would you be willing to go higher?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I can offer 475 euros per month.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: Your offer is getting closer to what I'm looking for, but I believe the apartment is worth even more considering its central location and the recent renovations. Would you be willing to make one final offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'll make my final offer 490 euros per month.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: I appreciate your persistence, but I'm sorry, your final offer is still not enough for me to accept. The apartment's location and condition justify a price that reflects its desirability. I'm not willing to accept any offer that doesn't meet my expectations. If you're not willing to increase your offer further, I'm afraid I'll have to decline and look for a tenant who values the apartment more accurately.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I feel that the price difference is too small to justify further negotiations.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: I understand your perspective, but as the landlord, I must ensure that the rental price reflects the true value of the apartment. If you're not willing to negotiate further, I'll have to consider other potential tenants who may be more willing to pay the price I'm looking for. Thank you for your time, and I hope we can reach an agreement in the future.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
